    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule(java.lang.String type,
            java.lang.String start,
            java.lang.String end,
            boolean required,
            java.lang.String behavior,
            java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Takes a text handling rule as created by the user and makes it into a self contained parser :O

        These come from the Rules file. And yes the params are ugly

        Parameters:
        type - the type of item this rule applies to
        start - the beginning of rule applicability (null for always applicable, "" to applicable after one char)
        end - the end of rule applicability (null for always applicable, "" to applicable after one char)
        required - true for these tokens are required, false for they are not allowed
        behavior - split for using the first half as is, text for converting all item to text
        tokens - the triggers for the rule
        See Also:
        Tweet, Rules, Tweet, Types

    • Method Detail

      • getApplicability

        public java.lang.String getApplicability(java.lang.String in)
        Returns what if a rule is applicable to an item It is very strict. Not only is matching done here but also in parsing by using the String result of this function (which is only non-empty if there is a match) to verify a match.

        This method returns empty if no match or type if match.

        Parameters:
        in - a string to be checked for applicability
        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        Tweet, Types

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns type a rule is applicable to

        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        Tweet, Rules, Types

      • process

        public java.lang.String[] process(java.lang.String in)
        Processes a string that has been determined to be applicable. However! it still has some checks to make sure it is applicable. Because people misuse stuff. Most of what it does is just pass the item into proccessRequired or NotAllowed depending on the rule set up.

        This method returns a String[]. The elements on 1 are to become text the elements on 0 are to become whatever type the item is.

        Parameters:
        in - a string to be processed with the rule
        Returns:
        String[]
        See Also:
        Tweet, Types, Rules

      • processNotAllowed

        private java.lang.String[] processNotAllowed(java.lang.String in)
        If a rule is processed as not allowed, this method takes a string and applies a rule to the portions that are necessary. Then it places the parts of the string that will be applied to the item type on an array index 0, then index 1 for text.

        Parameters:
        in - a string to be processed as not allowed
        Returns:
        String[]
        See Also:
        Tweet, Types

      • processRequired

        private java.lang.String[] processRequired(java.lang.String in)
        If a rule is processed as required, this method takes a string and applies a rule to the portions that are necessary. Then it places the parts of the string that will be applied to the item type on an array index 0, then index 1 for text.

        Parameters:
        in - a string to be processed as required
        Returns:
        String[]
        See Also:
        Tweet, Types

      • removeUnapplicableEnd

        private java.lang.String removeUnapplicableEnd(java.lang.String in)

      • removeUnapplicableStart

        private java.lang.String removeUnapplicableStart(java.lang.String in)
